Author: Alright#0419
Content: Does it build cclib.so by just running `build.sh`?

Author: Alright#0419
Content:
I need to do some tests, but I was experiencing problems with it. On a fresh clone, just `build.sh` would work. However after this I needed to do 
```
cd ~/komodo/src/cc
./makecclib
cd ..
make
../zcutil/build.sh```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: My dpowminconfs branch is kind of old and I can't even remember if I based it off of the dev or jl777 branches. So I used `git merge-base` to find the common ancestors to each branch. Then I saw jl777 was the newer ancestor, and so I know to merge jl777 branch into my dpowminconfs branch

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content:
```
(loki)(~/git/komodo dpowminconfs $% )$ git merge-base dpowminconfs jl777
76024c356eae352b03c91ec78a611a4761f8311b
(loki)(~/git/komodo dpowminconfs $% )$ git merge-base dpowminconfs dev
cbb4633e21554d20142bbee51e2c1a5543303f72
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: FUN GIT FACT

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Git cannot auto-resolve a conflict if you add something to the end of "hunk" of text, but if you randomly insert into the middle, it won't create these conflicts
